name: Tricenatorus
description: The Tricenatorus is a Huge monstrosity with immense physical presence, featuring notable melee and ranged attack capabilities, highlighted by its powerful bite, gore, and regenerative tail spikes.
memorable: Its ability to stay at 1 hit point instead of falling unconscious makes it a relentless threat in combat.
goals: To engage in brutal physical confrontations, targeting weakened foes for maximum advantage.
relations: May serve or be allied with creatures that benefit from its destructive capabilities.
environment: Typically found in environments where it can leverage its siege abilities, likely in places prone to conflict or destruction.
strengths: High hit points, strong melee damage, and the ability to regenerate tail spikes for ranged attacks.
weaknesses: Low Dexterity makes it vulnerable to ranged attacks, and its below-average Intelligence limits tactical options.
attacks: Devastating attacks including a powerful bite that can grapple foes, a gore attack that can knock enemies prone, and ranged tail spikes for distance combat.
most_powerful_ability: Blood Frenzy allows it to gain advantage on attacks against already injured foes, enhancing its offensive capabilities.
senses: Has a passive Perception of 15, allowing it to notice threats and navigate its environment effectively.
skills: Possesses proficiency in perception, enabling it to be vigilant regarding its surroundings.
additional_information: Resistant to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
The Siege Monster trait allows it to deal double damage to structures.
Multiattack enables two offensive actions in a single turn.
Uses tail spikes strategically, with 24 spikes available for combat.
Relentless trait allows it to remain standing even when reduced to fatal levels of damage.
test_queries: huge monster with strong melee attacks
monstrosity that grapples and knocks foes prone
powerful creature with tail spike attacks
durable monster resistant to physical damage
beast that thrives on attacking weakened enemies
